11121122111211.content:
The next mourning after cakes and sweets for breakfast Sokka was getting ready for was going to be quite the ordeal for him. Trying to convince a group of warrior woman, who he insulted the other day, to train him in their no doubt very selective ways of combat. But before he headed out the door he noticed Katara, who was still naked in bed by the way, looking out the window with a worried expression. He walked back to her placing a soothing hand on her shoulder "What's the matter?" he asked gently.

"*Sigh* I'm worried about Aang." she pointed to the young Avatar outside being chased by a hoard of little fan girls. He was laughing and showing off his air bending to make the chase more exciting. "I don't want all this Avatar worship to go to his head."

He understood were she was coming from but felt like he had to play devil's advocate "Hey, he may be The Avatar, but he is still a kid. I think that after finding out what happened to his people he deserves to be happy and carefree for a little bit. Especially since he's no doubt going to be fighting The Fire Nation for a while yet." he said diplomatically.

"I suppose your right." she reluctantly agreed, but her expression quickly turned stern as she crossed her arms "But if he starts thinking that just because he's The Avatar he can do whatever he wants, then he's got another thing coming if I have anything to say about it." Sokka chuckled at this and Katara narrowed her eyes at him "What's so funny?"

"You really are his mom aren't you?" he asked amused.

Her glared deepened, but it quickly gave way to laughter "*Giggle* I suppose I am. So, does that make you the dad?" she asked with a cheeky raised eyebrow.

"Hmm..I guess it does. We did kind of adopt him after the Air Temple." he continued the joke.

"That's right we did. Wow, barely of age and we already have a kid."

"You know.." he said huskily as he wrapped his arms around her stroking her belly with one hand and cupping her breast in another "I had a dream last night of us having real kids of our own together."

"Mmm..really? How many?" she asked sultry leaning against his chest while rubbing her ample buttocks against his hardening penis.

"A dozen. And you had another on the way. You were so beautiful with a belly so big you looked ready to pop. Smiling that wonderful smile of yours watching our younger kids play in the snow while I am telling our older sons war stories by the fire. And then you would notice the pot boiling telling you that dinner is ready. You call everyone over and hand out bowls of stew, handing me the biggest one naturally, and we would sit next to each other watching our family eat as I stroke you swollen belly hoping for another son to teach how to hunt." he narrated softly into her ear.

Hearing such a wonderful tale as her true love worshiped her body made Katara crazy with arousal, but she remembered that they both had important things to do today. So with great willpower she broke free of Sokka's embrace to get ready for the day, but not before turning back to send him one last loving smile "One day." she repeated their vow from last night.

"One day." he responded with a smile of his own. He got up from the bed to give a quick kiss as he went out the door "I'm off."

"Good luck."

choices: Sokka vs Zuko! Round 2.
111211221112112.content:
When Suki had agreed to train Sokka in the ways of The Kyoshi Warrior, after he apologized for yesterday, she mostly did it as a way to get payback and have fun at his expense. When he don the uniform, face paint and all, she had to try her hardest not to laugh. And she nearly lost it when Aang walked by and said with casual cheer "Hey Sokka! Nice dress!"

But as the day went on she found her opinion of him improve thanks to his genuine desire to learn and surprising talent when it came to combat. In just 7 hours of practice he was already getting a hang of the basics. Plus he was pretty funny with his quick wit and sarcasm. She found herself getting curious about what life was like were he came from, with her living on Kyoshi Island all her life she wasn't as familiar with other cultures as she would have liked to be. So she figured now was good opportunity to fix that.

She called for a break and giggled a little as Sokka collapsed onto the floor in exhaustion. She sat down next to him, giving him a minute to catch his breath before she asked "Hey Sokka, what was it like growing up in the South Pole?"

Sokka blinked in surprise at her question, but saw no reason not to answer. So he got into a more comfortable seating position and answered with his trademark sarcasm.

"Oh it's great really. Everyday we enjoy things like unrelenting cold, winters were you don't see a glimmer of sunlight for months, blizzards that can come out of nowhere and bury you alive if you get caught in them. We also enjoy scarce food to eat, barely enough firewood to keep warm. And for the piece of resistance we have the oh so lovely activity of hunting Tiger-Seal all by yourself for days on end in freezing cold winds, checking the position of the sun every hour so you don't get lost and know when to set up camp for the night, hoping you don't freeze to death in your sleep. Then finally finding a Tiger-Seal, killing it with only a boomerang and your wits, followed by dragging the carcass all the way back to your village of women and children who haven't had a decent meal in almost a week, all the while fighting off any predators that want to steal your kill. Then rinse and repeat. So yeah, it's a paradise. I don't know why we even left." he finished with a nonchalant shrug.

Suki's eyes and mouth widened in shock, he had to be kidding right? That sounded like hell to her and he made it sound like it was no big deal! But before she could call him out she noticed that despite his devil may care attitude, his eyes seemed old. Like they had seen things, horrible things, that no one should ever have to see. You couldn't fake something like that.

"Did you really do that, all by yourself?" she asked with equal awe and horror. She really hoped that wasn't the case, but her fears were confirmed when he silently nodded. "But why?! Why didn't anyone to help you?!" she asked with indignation as tears welled up in her eyes.

"Because their was nobody to help me. My father and the other men of our tribe left 2 years ago to help fight The Fire Nation. Leaving me, the only one left with any skill in fighting and hunting to provide for a village of withered wife's, elders and little children. And before you ask about why Katara didn't help me with her water bending, it's because she's the only Waterbender in The South Pole. She's had no one to teach how to control her powers. She has been getting better at it lately, but she still has a lot to learn. That's why we're going to the North Pole, to find her and Aang a master." he explained in a even tone.

Then a thought accord to Suki "Wait, if your the only provider for your village then why did you leave?" she asked in suspicion starting to think that was actually making what he said earlier to make himself sound cool.

But all he did was smile softly and calmly said "Aang is why I left. Before we began our journey he and Appa were an enormous help in making sure our village had enough supplies to last them until summer. So I can rest easy knowing I haven't left my father down when he entrusted my with keeping everyone safe."

His voice and demeanor then turned carefree again "Besides after we help Aang defeat The Fire Nation and I become Chief because of my heroism, I'm going to turn my dinky little village in to a thriving city, complete with an ice castle for me." he boasted while standing up to give a "heroic" pose.

Despite his goofiness Suki was looking at Sokka in a whole new light. She thought that he was just a arrogant boy from some village in the middle of nowhere. But she was wrong, she was the arrogant one. Sure she had been well trained in combat all her life, but she hadn't ever risked her life before. While this young man had to risked his life, all on his own, on a daily basis just to eat. While she was always guaranteed a hot meal and had the rest of The Warriors to back her up if a fight ever came to Kyoshi.

"You are a much better warrior then I am Sokka." she said with complete sincerity.

Sokka looked at her like she had just lost her mind. Didn't she kick his ass yesterday with no effort whatsoever? And that somehow made him the better warrior? How did that make any sense?!

Reading his mind she elaborated "I now understand that there is a difference between a fighter and a warrior. A small one mind you, but a difference none the less. A fighter is someone who has been well trained and when the time comes can hold their own or even win. But that doesn't mean they've ever been in a real fight before."

She the stood up to look him in the eye "But a warrior, a true warrior, is someone who weather or not the have trained for it has been in many life or death battles and has emerged victorious. I may be the better fighter between the two of us, but you Sokka, are without a doubt the better warrior." she said with eyes full of kindness and understanding.

Sokka was speechless. Here was someone he admired, someone he knew could kick his butt any day of the week telling him that he was a great warrior. Sure Katara had told things like that before and he knew she meant it, but she was his sister/lover. He knew that her opinion was biased. But he knew that Suki didn't have a high opinion of him at first, with good reason honestly. And now to see look at him like he was a hero was an indescribable feeling.

But then the village elder came running up to them yelling in distress "Fire Nation soldiers have landed on our shores! Girls come quickly!" he ran back to the village with Suki following after him

"Hey I'm not a..ugh whatever!"

1112112211121121.content:
Kyoshi Island was in a panic as for the first time in many years Fire Nation soldiers were on their island with ill intent. Everyone was hiding in their homes praying that the spirits or Kyoshi Warriors or Avatar would drive them off the island. Unfortunately Zuko would not be denied this or any chance to return home with the Avatar in chains. So he ordered his men to roam the street on their Komodo-Rhinos to drag him out of hiding.

Luckily the Warriors caught them by surprise as years worth of training was finally put to use. With the other Warriors taking care of Zuko's men, Suki went straight for the banished prince himself hoping to end this quickly. But for all her skill she was not ready for Zuko's Rhino to quickly spin around and smack her to the ground hard with it's tail. Zuko then sent a fireball at her to finish it and all Suki could do was watch, frozen in horror as the deadly flames closed in on her.

But fortunately for her Sokka came in just the nick of time, using a war fan to block the fire like a shield. Take a second to look behind him to make sure Suki was okay, which she was, Sokka then turned to face Zuko with a glare. "He scarface! Pick on someone your own size!" he said to keep the princes attention on him while Suki got back on her feet.

Zuko blinked in surprise as he felt like he knew that voice. He looked a little closer at the warrior in front of him and found that he did recognize him, it was the warrior from The South Pole. Only this time he was wearing a dress and make up. Zuko smirked and said with amusement "Nice dress."

Sokka just took the jab at him in stride "Your just jealous. Cause only a real man can pull off a dress this fabulous." he said with pride as he posed like a model. Before Zuko could make a come back a Kyoshi Warrior tackled him of his Rhino. Sokka then looked back at Suki to see her back on her feet "I guess training's over!" he remarked as went back into the fight with Suki following after.

Sokka, Suki, and the other warrior surrounded Zuko, but that proved to be a mistake as the tenacious Firebender sent out a fury of spinning flame kicks that only Sokka managed to dodge. While the other warrior was sent crashing into a house and Suki hit her back hard against a support beam.

Sokka and Zuko then found themselves staring each other down in the street, waiting for the other to make the first move. Deciding to put an end to this himself Zuko sent a barrage of fire at Sokka. Using his war fan to block the flames Sokka then pulled out his boomerang and threw it, but just before it could hit it's mark Zuko caught the boomerang in mid-air. But his victory was short lived as not a second later a closed war fan came flying and hit the Firebender right between the eyes.

With the prince dazed Sokka then ran up to give him a flying kick to the torso. But just the blow made contact Zuko caught his leg and grappled him to the ground. With the warrior pinned and out of tricks Zuko readied his flaming fist to finally rid himself of this pest. But then a powerful gust of wind seemed to come out of nowhere and blasted the prince into a nearby house.

Sokka quickly pick himself up, looked behind him and sure enough their was Aang wielding a pair of war fans "I had that handled you know." Sokka grumbled as he dusted himself off.

"Sure you did." Aang said with a knowing grin.

Despite the small victory it was becoming clear that for all the skill The Kyoshi Warriors had they couldn't protect their homes from the unrelenting flames of Zuko and his men. Knowing that Zuko would follow them Sokka said that their best plan was to leave before the entire village was reduced to ash. So Aang called Appa and Katara quickly packed their supplies while Sokka helped the warriors fight off the Firebenders until they were ready to leave.

But just before Sokka could get on Appa, Suki grabbed his hand, turned him around and kissed him on the lips. Sokka was frozen stiff at this sudden move. Because as much as he hated to admit it, kissing Suki was amazing. Almost as amazing as kissing Katara. After a few seconds of intense liplock Suki broke the kiss and looked up at a stunned Katara with a challenging smirk "I'm not going to lose to you!" she proclaimed as she went of to hold of the Firebenders.

Sokka stood there for a second, red faced with a goofy grin on his face, before a call from Katara snapped him back to reality and he joined the others on Appa. But just before they really left the island Aang dived into bay, rode The Unagi and made it pray a rain of water onto the village, putting out the fires. With the village saved Aang jumped of The Unagi into Appa arms.

"I know I know. That was stupid and dangerous." said the Airbender as climbed back into the saddle.

"Yes, it was." said Katara as a matter of factly. But proud of him all the same as he gave him a motherly hug, which Aang thoroughly enjoyed.

"Good job out there son." said a now clear faced Sokka as he gave Aang a friendly pat on the back "You do your old man proud."

"You guys playing as my parents is going to be a running gag isn't it?" Aang said a little annoyed.

"Yep."

"*Sigh* Figures."

"That reminds me." Katara said in sweet tone that for some reason inspired fear instead of comfort "Aang, sweetie, could you give us some privacy. Mom and dad need to have a little..talk." she said that last word through clenched teeth.

Aang sensing the danger immediately scurried to Appa's head, leaving a petrified Sokka alone to face Katara's wrath.

11121122111211211.content:
"Now Sokka, you have 2 minutes to explain what that kiss Suki gave you was all about as well as give me a good reason why I shouldn't toss you into the ocean." Katara threatened with that same deceptively sweet tone that sent a chill of freight down his spine.

Sokka took in a deep breath to gather his nerve and looked her straight in the eye and answer her honestly, if a little too quickly "Katara, love of my life, I have no idea why Suki kissed me like that. All I did with her all day was train, although she did ask what life was like at The South Pole just before Zuko came and for some reason after I gave her a little insight into what life was like back home she said I was a better warrior then her. Which I still have no idea why she said that since she can kick my ass without even trying so-" his tangent was cut off by Katara raising her hand signaling him to stop.

"I see. It all makes sense now." she said evenly nodding to herself.

[It does?] Sokka tilted his head in confusion.

Seeing the admittedly cute look of confusion on his face she decided to take pity on him and explain "Think about it Sokka, life is very hard where we come from. It's been especially hard for us ever since dad left. Which meant you no doubt told her how you had to do the work of several men all by yourself to help take care of our tribe. And if there is anything a woman in her right mind looks for in a man it's someone who is brave, dependable, strong in body and will, smart when he actually uses his head, funny, handsome and above all else loyal." she listed while looking at him with equal amounts of love and annoyance. Love, because she believed he had all these qualities and then some. Annoyance, because now another woman saw these same qualities and now wanted Sokka for herself.

After hearing all the things she listed Sokka had very proud but also embarrassed look on his face "You really think I'm all those things?" he asked rubbing the back of his neck.

"Of course I do. Why do you think I fell in love with despite you being my brother?" she asked like it was the most obvious thing in the world. Her eyes the turned sad as looked down to the floor "I suppose it was only a matter of time that other women would see it too."

"Katara-" he move to embrace her, to let her know that she was the only one for him, but she stopped him with a hand on his chest and a stern gaze.

"I'm still mad at you for kissing another women right in front of me. So as punishment, no foreplay, no kissing, no hugging until I say otherwise." she laid it out firmly. Normally this would have made Sokka whine and complain, but since he was in fact guilty of this he had no room to talk. Sure Suki kissed him, but he knew that was hardly an excuse.

"I understand." he said quietly.

"Good." she simply stated as she moved over to join Aang on Appa's head to get some much neede space. Aang looked at her from the corner of his eye wondering if there was anything he could do to help. But before he could even open his mouth Katara said flatly "Just fly Aang."

"Yes mam."

(4 days later.)

Things have been a little tense for our heroes ever since Kyoshi Island. So Aang thought that a little fun would smooth things over for Katara and Sokka. So he decide to make a quick stop by Omashu to show his friends one of his favorite past times from 100 years ago, using the mail system as a giant super slide. But it didn't really go as he had planned, instead of having fun they ended up crashing through several roof tops, houses and finally crashing on top of one very unfortunate merchant's cabbage cart. (NO MY CABBAGES!!)

Which then lead them up to meet the King of Omashu to face judgement. Oddly enough instead of punishing them he threw them a feast and told the some jokes. Jokes that only Sokka found funny. But the feast actually turned out to be a clever ruse to reveal Aang as the Avatar. With that cat out of the bag the king the decided to make Aang face 3 deadly challenges. And to make sure he cooperated the king placed rings of pure Jennamite, crystal that grows very fast when in contact with organic matter, on Katara and Sokka.

The king said by nightfall the crystal will completely cover them and he would stop it if Aang managed to complete his challenges. So Aang's challenges were getting the king's lunchbox key from under a powerful waterfall, finding his pet Flopsie and fighting in a dual. He even aloud Aang to choose his opponent and Aang chose to fight the king. This prove to be a poor choice as despite his age the king was one of the most powerful Earthbenders in the world.

As Sokka and Katara watched Aang fight for his life, and by extension theirs, Katara felt now was a good time to come clean about a few things. "Sokka it's okay if you want to be with other women if you want." she said somberly.

Sokka turned his attention away from the battle to look at her with disbelief "Katara what are you talking about?! I would never-"

"Don't say it!" she stopped him. Tears started to well in her eyes as she looked at him with heartbreak "Don't make this harder for me then it already is."

"Katara I don't understand." he said so confused.

"Sokka as much as we love each other, as much as we may have promised to one day have children of our own. There is one thing we can never do. And you know exactly what I'm talking about." she explained with an increasingly pained voice. Realization hit Sokka like a lightning bolt as he awkwardly walked over to her and place his forehead against hers in a loving manor.

"We can't get married." he said with great sorrow.

111211221112112111.content:
Sokka wanted so desperately to embrace Katara, to wipe away her tears, to tell her that everything was okay and that he loved her. But he couldn't, not just because of the crystal slowly encasing his entire body, but also because he knew that there was nothing he could say or do to change the ultimate fact that their love could never be made official in the eyes of their tribe. It was something deep down they always knew, despite all the promises they made to have children together, if the truth of their bond was ever revealed, they would be disowned and forever banished. Sure their Gran-Gran accepted them, but they very much doubted the rest of the tribe will be as open minded. And spirits only knew how their father will react.

The forbidden lovers were so lost in their shared sorrow that they didn't notice that Aang had impressed the king enough to say he passed his final test. The king earth bend his way back up to the podium to see the couple pressing their foreheads together in want seemed to be a very sad but loving way. In fact it reminded him of the two lovers Oma and Shu, the tragic couple who his city was named after, it clearly told him that even though these two loved each other very much something was stopping them from truly being together. He wondered what for a few seconds before it came to him, upon a closer look at the young lovers he notice a few similarities that went beyond hailing from the same region, these two were related and from how small he heard The Southern Tribe was they were likely either cousins or siblings. He would put his money on siblings.

He heard Aang join him on the podium and when the young Avatar saw the state of his friends he turned to the king with a determined glare "I passed you test, now honor your promise!"

Originally the king was going to take this opportunity to teach Aang the real meaning behind the tests, but seeing the rather complicated situation his friends faced he thought it would be better to help them first "Don't worry I'm a man of my word." he said as he clenched his fist Earthbending the Jennamite to explode off of Sokka and Katara. The king grabbed on of the crystal shards from mid-air "Jennamite is made from rock candy." he said happily chewing the piece "Delicious!" But he saw that the mood was still rather down as the now freed couple embrace one another like it was the end of the world "Right..not the time for that." he said somberly.

Aang's face turned solemn as he noticed it wasn't a happy hug his friends were having "It's been hard for them these last few days. The used to be inseparable, but now.." Aang paused as he couldn't think of the right way to explain with revealing the true nature of their bond. He knew that most of the rest of the world was not as open minded as he was even 100 years ago.

"It's alright I understand." the king said gently as he approached the siblings. Seeing him moving towards them Sokka placed himself in front of Katara in a protective stance, but the king motioned that it was alright as he leaned in and whispered "You two can't get married because you're siblings aren't you?"

Hearing him discover the truth rocked the forbidden couple to the core and made them worry that they were about to be thrown in to the dungeon for the rest of their lives. But their fears were unfounded as the king gave them a kind smile and said "Don't worry I won't punish you. Why would I punish two young lovers for being in love? That's pretty much the story of how my kingdom was made."

"But..how did you figure out we were.." Sokka asked still shocked that their secret was found out.

"A good king needs to be a good judge of character. And I can tell that you two are good kids." His face the turned a little mischievous as a solution to their plight came through his wacky but brilliant mind "In fact I'll let you in on a little secret. The Avatar has the legal and spiritual authority to marry anyone! Hehehe!*Snort*"

"He does?!"

"I do?!"

"When you have saved the world and helped to maintain peace between the Physical and Spirit worlds for thousands of years you tend to pick up a lot of favors and perks along the way, wouldn't you agree?" the king gave them a knowing wink. But the his face turned serious "Of course this can only be done when Aang is recognized as a fully realized Avatar, which likely won't happen until he defeats The Fire Nation, and you still have to follow some of your tribes customs in order for it to be considered valid, but the possibility is very real. I have learned many things about every nations customs and traditions over the years, it's a bit of a hobby of mine, and I learned that for the Water Tribe there are three rules that must be followed in order for a marriage to be made official." he held up three fingers to get his point across.

"Number 1: Both betrothed have to be of age. Number 2: The man must give the woman a betrothal necklace that he carved himself. And number 3: The ceremony must be held on the night of a full moon, near the ocean, with a least one witness from your respected tribe attending. If these conditions are met then even a marriage between siblings can be possible. So I suppose this gives you another reason help Aang save the world eh? Although I would say saving the world just for the sake of saving the world is all the reason you need, but if you needed a reason fighting for the right to be with the one you love is as good as any."

Just as he finished he was nearly tackled to the ground by Katara as she gave the king a powerful, heartfelt hug "Your majesty, you're a mad genius!" she exclaimed with tears of joy.

The king patted her on the head comfortingly "It's just like I always say, instead of always seeing just what people want you to see, you've got to open your brain to the possibilities." he said wisely.

"Wait a minute.." said Aang after hearing that familiar advice. He gave the king a closer look and then it finally clicked "BUMI?!?!" he shouted in disbelief.

"Took you long enough to figure it out Aang. Hehehehe!*Snort*"

(1 hour later.)

Katara And Sokka watched the two old friends relive the good old days using the mail system as a slide one last time before they had to leave with find smiles on their faces. With the knowledge that it was possible for them to get married putting them in a mood much like how they felt on the night of the party before they left home.

"You know, I'm still allowing to be with other women Sokka." she said seemingly out of nowhere.

"You are?!" he asked in disbelief.

"Sokka, for as much as I want you all to myself, I know that it would be much easier to just accept the fact that other women are going to fall for you. And even though we are going to have many children together, we still need to keep the gene pool of our village diverse." she said pragmatically. Her face then turned stern "That being said, I will not tolerate you just picking up any floozy of the street. I will only accept women who will love as much as I do and you have to receive my permission first before you pursue another woman. Understand?"

"Absolutely!" Sokka said with glee as he embraced her. [Spirits I love this woman!]

"Good." she said warmly returning the hug Meanwhile in the background you could hear the sound of Aang and Bumi's joy ride ending as they crashed into a familiar cart.

"NO MY CABBAGES!!"

1112112211121121112.content:
Ever since Bumi told them that it was possible for Sokka and Katara to get married Team Avatar adventure seemed to kick into high gear as just a few days ago Katara helped restore hope back into a Earth Kingdom village that had all its Earthbenders held prisoner on a metal ship yard. It took some effort and Sokka was not very happy at fist with her stubbornness when it came to helping those in need, but they managed to restore the imprisoned Earthbenders will to fight for their freedom by giving them coal to fight back against their captors. Unfortunately Katara lost her mothers necklace in the battle, Sokka promised her that they would find it and when the time came he would give her a necklace of her own. And then when they had a daughter she will be able to past it down to her. Needless to say Sokka got very lucky that night.

And now they found themselves helping a village that was being attacked by an angry spirit named Hei Bai. Aang didn't really have any idea what he was doing, but he still tried his best to calm the spirit, with little success. When the black and white spirit was about to turn his anger towards Aang, Sokka threw his boomerang to try and stop him. But all that managed to do was get Sokka spirited away to The Spirit world.

When an angry spirit takes a human to The Spirit World they are powerless to the whims of the spirit that takes them since bending is impossible in The Spirit World, so a none bender is just as helpless. However with the Solstice approaching many spirits can do things they normally couldn't do before, like travel to The Physical world at will. And a particularly powerful spirit can bend the rules of time so that a year could pass in The Spirit World, but in The Physical world only a day would pass.

And ever since Aang was freed from the iceberg some very powerful spirits have been keeping a close eye on our heroes, Sokka in particular. These spirits saw great potential in Sokka and now they had the opportunity to help him realize that potential. The only question was, what sort of spirit will Sokka encounter? And what kind of potential of his will be unleashed?

11121122111211211122.content:
Sokka was hopelessly lost. The last thing he remembered was that spirit monster having him in it's clutches and Aang trying to safe him, but then everything went black. When he came to he found himself on the shore of some far away island in the middle of nowhere. He had now spent the last 6 hours wondering around aimlessly trying to get a sense of where he was and how he can get back.

Although Sokka had to admit the island he was on was pretty amazing. In fact he would go as far to say that it was the perfect get away vacation spot. Very tropical with vast lush valleys, mountain ranges, even a volcano. [When the war is over I can definitely see myself retiring here.] he thought to himself. The only odd thing about this place was the lack of wildlife. No birds, mammals, reptiles, he hasn't even seen any bugs around. Despite the clearly thriving ecosystem there was no sign of sentient life anywhere.

Then after hours of searching he finally found someone, but this someone wasn't human. In fact this someone was unlike anything he had ever seen before and he had seen some extraordinary things this last month. Sitting on top of a flat stone in deep meditation was a male humanoid lion. He was a towering 8ft tall with god-like muscles that most warriors could spend decades trying to obtain but never match. Katara leaned herself against Sokka's shoulder in fake helplessness "Oh Sokka, please save me from the pirates!" she said with dramatic damsel in distress voice, complete with batting her eyelashes.

Sokka was not amused with her, but he knew that she knew he couldn't say no to her "You are so lucky you're cute. But we are going to have a talk about this later." he said flatly as he cracked his knuckles while calmly walking towards the pirates.

They laughed at the warrior apparent foolishness at facing them alone, but quickly changed their tune as Sokka seemed to move in a blur of speed as he effortlessly pick one guy up and threw him into a nearby, familiar chart. "MY CABBAGES!! This place is worse then Omashu!" shouted the merchant as walked off.

The first mate charged at Sokka with his duel knifes and 2 of his shipmates, both wielding sovnya staffs, also charged him. Sokka grabbed hold of one of the first mates knifes in a disarming lock and push kicked the first mate into the harbor.

Just as one of the pirates was about to skewer him Sokka jumped on top of the flat side of his weapon's blade, using his weight to drive it to the ground. The other pirate came up not a second later, but he didn't even look Sokka as he leaned his body out of the way slightly and trapped his weapon with his arm. He then gave the pirate behind him a backwards headbutt to the face, making him let go of his weapon and used the pole end to hit the pirate in front of him in the nose and side kicked him so hard in the stomach he was sent flying into a nearby pile of wooden boxes.

Sokka the used the sovnya to sweep the pirate behind him off his feet before he could recover and then slammed him into the ground so hard he broke the pole.

The last pirate came running up, duel wielding a pair of nunchaku like a madman. Sokka skillfully dodged the wild strikes and when he saw the right moment low kicked him in the knee, following up with grabbing both side of his head hitting him with a flying knee.

Seeing that all of the swashbucklers were down for the count Sokka wiped his hands at a job well done just as Katara nearly tackled him with a hug "My hero!" she sighed in content.

"I'm still mad at you."

"Katara!" he called out with surprising authority that made her stand at attention. She was trying to learn one of the scrolls forms called The Water Whip, with little success. She looked back at him nervously since she hasn't heard that tone of voice ever since their dad left. He picked up the scroll, gave the techniques a quick once over with a thoughtful look before nodding to himself and turning his attention back to her "Come with me. Aang don't follow us, we'll be back." he ordered as he rolled up the scroll and walked further down the river with Katara meekly following after him.

After half an hour of walking and feeling out the chi of the area to make sure they were alone Sokka stopped to look at a timid Katara nervously playing with her braid. Seeing her so vulnerable made his eyes soften a bit, but he shook his head to steel himself, this needed to be done.

"Katara, you know what you did was very selfish and dangerous right?" he asked with his arms crossed in a strong stance.

"Well you beat the pirates in the end." she weakly defended herself "Besides they stole that scroll from a Waterbender."

"It doesn't matter if I was able to beat them or not, because the point is you put our lives in danger just so you could learn some flashy splashes." He saw her open mouth to talk, but cut her off "And don't try and tell me that you did it for Aang because we both know that just an excuse." She closed her mouth and stared back at the floor in defeat "You want to learn from this scroll?" he held up said scroll for emphasis "Well then you're going to learn from it since I'm going to teach you the forms." he said as he pocketed the scroll.

Katara looked at him like he had grown an extra head "You're going to teach me?" she asked in disbelief.

"I may not be a bender, but I recognize the forms from my own training. Even without being able to bend the elements, every form is a legitimate martial art that can help oneself become stronger in many ways. Master Shizi taught me many techniques from every form of bending, not just to add to my arsenal, but also to teach me the strengths and weaknesses of each element. So that when I encounter a hostile bender I know the best way to counter them." he explained as he went through some forms to warm himself up and to prove he wasn't just bragging.

"But don't get the wrong idea." he said pointing a stern finger at her before she got her hopes to high "This not a reward, it's a punishment. I am going to run you into the ground learning these forms until they become as natural to you as breathing. And any mistake, no matter how small, will be met with this!" Quick as a flash he gave her ample butt a harsh slap.

"AH!!" she cried out in surprise and pain. Her hands instinctively went to rub her sore cheek but then her other cheek was smacked too "AH!!"

"Try to sooth the pain and you will be smacked. If you talk back to me you will be smacked. Hell if I just feel like it you will be smacked." Katara felt her heart freeze as his tone and look in his eye was cold and hard as blue ice. No sympathy or any of the usual warmth was to be found, it was like he was a completely different person and it scared her. "Because at this moment, I am not your brother, I am not your lover, I am not your friend. I am your master. And you will obey me without question, understand?"

"Sokka you're scaring *Smack* Ahh!!"

"Do..You..Understand?" His eyes and voice became even colder.

She whimpered and nodded frantically "Yes! I understand master!" she said submissively.

"Good. Now copy my stance." he instructed as he got into the first forms starting position. She did as best she could, only to be smacked again "Straighten your back out." he said calmly like he didn't just assault her plump rear. She did as instructed, trying her best to ignore the pain. "Better. Now follow my lead."

The long hours into the night followed a similar pattern as Sokka instructed Katara. True to his word any mistakes were met with a harsh spank to her delicious backside. Interestingly enough despite the rather harsh and unorthodox method the training was yielding very positive results. With the added motivation to not get her butt smacked and with Sokka as a visual reference to what she needed to do instead of just blindly trying to figure it out herself Katara was quickly learning. And the better she did the less smacks she got.

Although if she was to be completely honest with herself she was beginning to enjoy the rather harsh treatment. Even though Sokka was cold to her through out the night she instinctively knew that his treatment of her came from a desire to make sure she could protect herself. Plus it felt good in a weird way to be so submissive to him. Ever since their mother died Katara had to grow up quickly and get strong out of pure necessity, but keeping up a strong front and stay in control all the time can be exhausting. So for her to surrender herself so completely to somebody she knew she can trust felt strangely liberating.

But then they heard a rustle in the bushes..

A big pirate shot a net from two large cross-bows at the siblings, but Katara's fresh training kicked in as she formed a water shield that she quickly turned to ice to stop the net. She then launched the large ball of ice at the thug before he could react, knocking him out cold. (hehe ice puns) Then another pirate tried to wrap a ball and chain around her legs, but she launched a quick blast of water to stop him mid-swig and followed up with a powerful torrent that knock him off his feet.

The fist mate and the nunchaku wielder came charging at her, but she formed a water whip and smacked them into each other with it. The rest the pirates came at her in full force thinking they could overwhelm her, but all they did was make her task easier. She called on all her chi, just as Sokka taught her, and with perfect form, made a big powerful wave, even bigger then the one Aang made, and washed all the pirates away. And to make sure they were down for the count she sent out a chilling breath that froze the swashbucklers in place.

She fell to her knees in exhaustion as all the training from earlier caught up with her and the wave, chilling breath combo used up all the strength she had left. But she felt a familiar, comforting hand on her shoulder. She looked up to see Sokka with eyes full of warmth again and a huge proud smile on his face "That's my girl." Katara felt bliss so strong at hearing his praise that combined with her exhaustion made her pass out. Sokka pick her up and gently carried her over to a tree to rest more comfortably. "You've done enough, I'll take it from here." he said to her as he tenderly cupped her cheek before turning to face Zuko and his men as they stepped out of the trees.

Sokka vanished in a blur of speed and reappeared in the middle of the small troop. Before they had time to react Sokka used chi blocking to down the troops so fast it looked he grew extra limbs. But just as he was about to do the same to Zuko, the banished prince drew dual broadswords and sent a fury of flaming slashes that Sokka had no choice but to dodge.

Once he was at a safe distance Sokka addressed Zuko with a smirk "The swords are new."

"I told you I would be ready the next time we met, crossdresser." Zuko said with a smirk of his own as he got into his battle stance.

Sokka pulled out his machete and knife and got into a dual wielding stance of his own "We'll see about that, jerkbender."

The rivals stared each other down for a minute before engaging in a fierce clash of blades. While Sokka's enhanced strength and speed nearly had Zuko on the back foot at times, the fire prince was a more experienced swordsmen and his Firebending enhanced attacks kept Sokka at a distance. As the duel continued for a few minutes with them evenly matched for the most part, Zuko was starting to see Sokka's strikes, blocks and counters getting slower. He then saw an opening and took full advantage of it by sending a powerful flaming side kick to Sokka's torso that sent him waist deep into the river.

Sokka was a little short of breath, but an idea came to him as he channeled his chi and sent a mighty splash of water that hit Zuko with such force he hit his back hard against a tree. Zuko recovered just in time to see Sokka charging at him with such blazing speed that he barely had enough time to dodge a punch that reduced the tree to splinters. Zuko was in awe at the raw power that Sokka had, but undeterred as he swept the ground at Sokka's feet with a flaming step, giving Sokka a literal hot foot that he comically scrambled to put out.

Even though his foot not on fire anymore Sokka felt like his lungs were [Damn, I almost had him. And that display of awesomeness is scaring him off like last time. I don't have much left in me, I got to think of something quick.] he thought frantically to himself as he panted like a dog in the summer heat.

Meanwhile Zuko's own mind was going a million miles a minute tying to figure out how Sokka was able to do the things he does. He thought back to the fights they had before as well as their current battle. And even though his new skill and power did change things up quite a bit, Zuko noticed that there was a pattern to how the southern warrior fought. He used his head in battle, always used every tool he had in clever ways, and he knew Sokka wasn't a bender because if he was then he could've used water from the river anytime he wanted. But the only time he did was when he was in the river. He didn't move the earth and while his speed was very much like an Airbender, he never heard of any Airbender who had that much raw strength in all his studies. Then he noticed how tired Sokka was compared to himself and suddenly it all came together.

"I see now," Zuko said in an enlightened tone of voice "You've somehow figured out to channel your chi to enhance your physical abilities. And by using the environment around you in creative ways you can make your own style of 'Fake Bending.' Very clever. But since your not a natural bender you have a much more finite amount of chi you can use, which means if you don't end a fight quickly you could find yourself at a major disadvantage. Tell me, am I wrong?" he asked with a self satisfied smirk.

Sokka cursed under his breath at Zuko figuring out his fighting style so easily, but gave him a smirk of his own "I have to admit, your smarter then I gave you credit for." he said honestly impressed.

Zuko's smirk widened "I'll let you in on a little secret. Firebenders can draw power from the sun, and look-" he turned his head to look at the sun starting to peak over the mountains "it will be little more then a minute tell sunrise. I can feel my Firebending getting stronger by the second, while your running on empty. Your finished."

"Don't count me out yet scarface!" Sokka shouted in defiance as he retook his stance "If got plenty of tricks up my sleeve!"

"Show me then, faker." Zuko said confidently retaking his stance. But just before the fight could really begin in earnest a powerful gust of wind came out of nowhere blasting Zuko like a skipping stone across the river.

"Damn it Aang! I had that under control!" Sokka shouted in frustration at the Airbender interfering again.

"I'm sure you did." Aang said nonchalantly as he went to check on Katara.

Sokka stared across the river with a steely glare as he saw Zuko recover from Aangs cheap shot to send a glare of his own "This isn't over." The warriors said at the same time.

111211221112112111221131121211.content:
We now find our heroes walking through a forest in order to see if they could avoid getting found by The Fire Nation. Sokka theorized that the reason that Zuko and others keep finding them was because Appa was to noticeable, much to Appa's annoyance. And while Katara and Aang did give him a bit of a hard time by making fun of his instincts they did trust his judgement and followed his lead. Then Sokka signaled them to stop as he sensed something up ahead.

"What is it?" Katara asked cautiously.

"I'm sensing a small platoon of Fire Nation soldiers, 20 in total, but only one of them is a Firebender. I'll bet he's the captain." Sokka informed in a quiet voice.

"What's the plan?" Aang asked.

Taking a minute to get a better read on the enemies strength Sokka turned to his friends with a confident smile "It's nothing we can't handle, so what do you guys say, up for messing with some Fire Nation?"

"Always." Katara said with a bold smile readying her water skin.

"You bet, besides I've been get bored from walking all mourning." Aang said eager for some fun.

"Alright here's the plan, Katara you'll take care of the captain while Aang and I will take care of the rest, sound good?" His friends nodded in agreement "Alright then, lets do this." Sokka said as he stepped through the bushes into the camp. The Fire troops turned in surprise to see 3 kids just casually walking into their camp. "Hey, hows it going?" Sokka asked casually. The troops responded by getting their weapons ready and surrounding the heroes while the captain launched a fire ball to light the bushes on fire to keep them in. But Katara intercepted the fire with a water shield and Aang readied his staff. "If you don't want us to hurt you, you'll surrender now." Sokka said calmly with his arms crossed.

The captain laughed at his insolence "You won't hurt us?" he asked in amusement right before he suddenly went limp and fell to the ground.

"Nice one Sokka! Even faster the usual!" Aang said very impressed.

"I thought I was the one to take care of the captain." Katara pouted at her lover apparently stealing her thunder.

"I..didn't do that." Sokka said confused at what just happened. But then he sensed something in the trees as a young man with piece of reed in his mouth, wielding twin hook swords jumped on top of 2 soldiers and not a second later used the his sword hooks to trip up 2 more soldiers and flipping them to the ground hard.

"Down you go." the young man said smoothly.

Then 5 more kids started come out of the trees taking on the troops in a admittedly impressive display. Aang and Katara helped were they could, while Sokka held back to get a better read on these newcomers to make sure they were really allies. From what he could read from their chi he could sense that all their aggression was focused on The Fire Nation. And while that did ease his worries at first, as he continued to read them he noticed that these kids had some deep resentment to The Fire Nation, especially the young man with the hook swords.

Now Sokka wasn't the biggest fan of The Fire Nation either, given the fact that a Firebender killed his mother and made his father leave home for over 2 years, but his training with Master Shizi didn't just include teaching him martial arts forms to improve his fighting but also history on what the world was like before the war. This included the fact that The Fire Nation actually was a steadfast ally of The Water Tribes for hundreds of years, especially against The Earth Kingdom. Which turned out to be the main aggressor for most of the wars that happened over human history, the most resent being the reign of Chin The Conqueror.

Sure the Fire Nation did cause the most damage to the world in the shortest amount of time, but that didn't change the fact that The Earth Kingdom had more civil and over seas wars under it's belt the any nation, so they were responsible for more then their far share of atrocities. Hell the Water Tribes even the Air Nomads had their share of psychos. This knowledge taught Sokka that everyone had the potential for great good or great evil. And that you shouldn't just automatically assume somebody is either until you get to know them.

Once the the soldiers were dealt the young man introduced himself as Jet and called the rest of the kids his Freedom Fighters. Jet said that they had been waiting to ambush the soldiers all mourning but needed the right distraction. Hearing his friends being referred to as a distraction did not sit right with Sokka, but he could see the logic in the strategy. It especially didn't sit right with him when Jet tried to put the moves on Katara, but he didn't have to worry as Katara immediately shut him down telling him that she was happily taken.

When Jet took offered them to take them to their hideout Sokka almost said no, but his instincts told him that he should keep a close eye on Jet. There was just something about him that really rubbed him the wrong way and he needed to find out what. As Jet showed him around The Freedom Fighters hideout he told our heroes some of the tragic stories of how they were hurt by The Fire Nation, including how his parents were killed right in front of him when he was only 8 years old.

Sokka could tell that Jet's pain was real and could sympathize with him, but he could also sense that his pain and hate was deeply rooted twisting him up inside like an overgrown weed. This was especially mad clear when the next day Jet said he needed Sokka's help with a "special mission." Said mission turned out to be amusing and robbing a innocent old traveler who just happened to be Fire Nation. And when they returned to the hideout Jet tried to spin the story in to his favor by telling Aang and Katara that the old man was an assassin sent to kill Jet, even showing them a poisoned knife as "proof."

Aang and Katara didn't know who to believe and then Jet convinced them that The Fire Nation was planning to burn down the forest and he needed their Waterbending to help fight the fires. Sokka didn't like were this was going one bit as he could see that he was manipulating his friends genuine desire to help those in need for his own ends. But he needed proof before he could do anything about it. Luckily his opportunity came the next early mourning he heard Jet and his most loyal followers pulling a cart full of barrels of Blasting Jelly. He woke Katara and Aang up and they silently follow them in the trees until they came to a cliff over looking the valley.

That was when Jet revealed his plan to fill the dam and then blow it up, using all the water to destroy the village in order to wipe out the Fire Nation in the area. Along with all the innocent men, women and children. When The Duke brought up his concern for the town Jet just told him that "It was the price to pay to free this valley." Aang and Katara were horrified at Jet's complete disregard for innocent life and Sokka was seething, but he noticed by reading the other Freedom Fighters chi that they also didn't like the idea of kill the innocent. But their hatred of the Fire Nation and loyalty to Jet was making them justify the act.

With all that in mind Sokka made his plan...
111211221112112111221131121211.title: Evil does not belong to one nation.

choices: Sokka vs Jet.
1112112211121121112211311212111.content:
"Aang, Katara stay here. I'll take care of this." Sokka instructed quietly. They looked at him with wide eyes that asked him how can we just stand by and do nothing. "I have a plan, do you trust me? he asked. Aang and Katara looked at each other for a minute wondering what he was planning, but then gave him a firm nod. "Then please, don't interfere. I promise it will be okay." he said reassuringly as he jumped from the tree to face the rouge freedom fighters.

"Sokka, I was hoping you'd join us." Jet said condescendingly as his fighters readied their weapons.

"You're not going to destroy the town Jet." Sokka said resolutely.

"I'm going to finally free this valley of The Fire Nation. I would have thought you of all people would understand that in war you have to make sacrifices in order to win."

"So 10 innocent people for every 1 soldier you kill is what you call a fair trade for victory?"

"If that's what it takes so be it."

"This is murder. And there is no right in murder, ever. Honestly at this point none of you are any different from The Fire Nation." The second he said that Pipsqueak grabbed him from behind in a bear hug and Smellerbee drew her knife and held it to Sokka's throat.

"You shut your damn mouth ponytail! We are nothing like The Fire Nation!" she shouted with seething anger.

"Hmm you know what your right." he said with calm sarcasm despite the blade at his neck "Planning to wipe out a town full of innocents just to kill a few of your enemies doesn't at all sound like something The Fire Nation would do, what was I thinking? Plus there is the fact that your using water instead of fire. Which I bet is going to help you sleep at night since it will drown out the screams of the little children as they're ripped from their mothers arms."

Hearing him call them out like this struck a cord in the Freedom Fighters, as all the ways they tried to justify what they were doing were effortlessly torn apart by Sokka unfiltered speech.

"Don't listen to him!" Jet said sternly trying to regain control of the situation "He just trying to turn you all against me."

"Your damn right I am." Sokka said proudly, not even bothering to deny it. "Because somebody has to tell them the truth of what they're doing at it sure as hell isn't going to be you."

"I've had enough of this. Pipsqueak, Smellerbee take him for a walk." Jet ordered.

"Oh sure keep listening to the psycho as he leads you over a cliff." Sokka felt the blade at neck press against his skin as Smellerbee sent him a glare, clearly getting fed up with him running his mouth.

"Listen ponytail, Jet is a great leader and better warrior then you will ever be. He helped us find a home when none of us had one, when The Fire Nation took everything from us. I will not let you insult all the good he's done." she said with barely contained rage.

"That old man he robbed the other day, he tried to paint him as a killer to sway Katara and Aang to his side and lied about the fires just to use them for his own ends. You know that old man was harmless and yet you robbed him and were willing to let Jet beat him while he was down. Does that really sound like being a great leader and warrior to you? Sounds like a ruthless thug and a liar to me." Sokka said to her straight in the eye.

Smellerbee's eyes narrowed and hands were starting to shake in rage. Not just at Sokka still running his mouth, but because as much as she hated to admit to herself, he had a point. Because there were many other days like that, were they would ambush people walking down the road, minding their own business, not hurting anyone. And yet the would attack them anyway, one day really stuck with her, a day that she had spent many sleepless nights thinking about.

She was alone with Jet that day, in fact it was the day he said he would make her his second in command if she passed the test. Her test came in the form of a little girl, lost in the woods looking for her parents. Her first instinct was to help her, but then Jet pointed out that she was Fire Nation. He then told her to remember all the things the Fire Nation did to her, to her friends, to him, to the world. He then said they deserve the same, ever last one of them. The screams of that little girl as they harassed her still haunted her to this day.

"You know what forget the walk." Jet said growing impatient from all the delays "Smellerbee, kill him."

Hearing such a cold order filled The Freedom Fighters with horror, especially Smellerbee. Because despite all the times they fought The Fire Nation they never really killed anyone. In fact that was the reason for the plan, so the could not only take out all The Fire Nation at once, but do so in a way were they won't have to see the bodies.

"But Jet we vowed to only fight The Fire Nation." Smellerbee said finally starting to see reason.

"He's a Fire Nation sympathizer which is just as bad if not worse. And I gave you an order Smellerbee, do it." Jet said with eyes void of care and a voice full of hate. It reminded her of the Firebenders that burned down her home. But still..

"Jet gave me an order. I have no choice. That's what your thinking now right?" Sokka asked her with a soothing voice full of understanding. She looked back at him stunned that he seemed to read her mind. He smiled at her "You always have a choice, that's what freedom is and it's what your fighting for right?"

That is what sealed it for her as she looked down at her knife realizing what she was becoming, the very thing she hated. And as she looked around at her friends she could see that they were doing the same, in fact Pipsqueak even let Sokka go once figured out what was happening

"Jet..maybe ponytail has a point." Smellerbee said.

"Okay for your information, this is a warriors wolf tail!" Sokka clarified pointing to his hair, but she ignored him.

"Maybe we have been going to far. Maybe we can find a better way to drive The Fire Nation out, without destroying the town." said really starting to like the idea. The other fighters agreed.

"I see." Jet said flatly "You're all traitors then."

Smellerbee's eyes widened at this and she was frozen in horror as she saw Jet's swords scissor around her neck, but just before her head was separated from her shoulders Sokka stop them with his knife and machete and pulled her to safety. With her safe Sokka sheathed his weapons and faced Jet.

"Jet stop before you will do something you'll regret." Sokka reasoned, but Jet was having none of it as he got into his stance.

"Once I kill you Sokka, the traitors are next." the fallen warrior said with a crazed look in his eye.

11121122111211211122113112121111.content:
Jet came at Sokka with a fury of sword swings that Sokka skillfully dodged using the Airbending forms that Master Shizi taught him. The next few minutes followed a similar pattern with Jet using every bit of skill he had to take Sokka down, but every attack hit nothing but air as Sokka waited him out. The fallen warrior's strikes were getting slower, sloppier from both exhaustion and his increasing anger.

"Jet I don't want to fight you." Sokka said patiently as the fight paused for Jet to catch his breath "I understand that The Fire Nation killed your parents, they killed my mother too. So if you just stop to think for a-"

"SHUT UP!!! SHUT YOU DAMN MOUTH SOKKA!!! YOU DON"T KNOW A FUCKING THING ABOUT HOW I FEEL!!!" Jet exploded with rage as he charged at Sokka swinging his swords like a madman. "So you lost you mother, well boo fucking hoo for you! You still have a girlfriend, a village to go back to, a father who's fighting the good fight against The Fire Nation swine! But I lost EVERTHING!!! he continued to vent as his swings got so sloppy and wild that Sokka barely had to bother to dodge anymore.

"My parents, my friends, my village, even my little brother!" Jet said with tears of rage and hurt streaming down his cheeks. "My mother was 8 months pregnant at the time of the attack! She hired a Waterbendering healer to find out the gender of the baby so we could prepare the new room properly for him! I was so happy to know that I was going to have little brother make fun of and help him grow into a man with my father! And then those Fire Nation BASTARDS KILLED THEM!!!" he cried to the heavens as fell to his knees after missing a double downward sword swing.

Everyone present had eyes widened in disbelief at hearing this awful tale, even The Freedom Fighters. They knew he lost his parents and home to The Fire Nation, but they didn't knew about him losing his little soon to be brother. The Duke look especially shocked as memories of how Jet would treat him like a sibling started to make much more sense in his mind.

"So you can go ahead a judge me all you want, but I won't stop until I rid the world of every last one of The Fire Nation scum!" While neither Sokka or Notai had grown up in forests or the like, their travels in the Earth Kingdom had caused them to learn much of how to hunt in them, of the signs to look for, the important clues that others might overlook. Once they found the creature's trail, it did not take them long to track it down, even staying downwind, and when they did find the beast, they were just a little awed.

Boarcupine.

Whales of the land, Notai said the men had called these creatures, when spoken of. Great, fearsome beasts of tusk and quill -- small, moving hills of muscle and sinew bristling with long, sharp, barbed quills. Dangerous, they were supposed to be, and incredibly so, to the extent that even saber tooth moose-lions dared not trifle with the beasts. They were big, mean, covered with natural weapons, and nearly impossible to bring down -- seemingly capable of moving under nothing but the power of pure, animal spite.

There was virtually nothing on land which counted the boarcupine as prey, and the beasts furthermore would gorge themselves as readily on flesh and marrow as on roots and bark.

Sokka got a little shiver at the base of his spine as he watched this great, formidable creature tear into what looked to be the mutilated corpse of a platypus bear, gore coating its snout as it devoured the guts of its prey -- or was it simply scavenging off the kill of another beast, or else some pestilence or disease? -- gorging itself indiscriminately on the putrid, stinking flesh of something that smelled like it had been dead for at least a week.

This would do nicely, he decided. This boarcupine would be a worthy kill, he was sure. It would doubtless make for many fine tools and weapons, and its meat could likely keep them and their friends fed for a month (aside from Aang), provided that they were able to dry, salt, or otherwise preserve it.

And also provided they were able to bring it down.

Sokka nodded at Notai, and he pulled out his boomerang at the same time she hefted one of the javelins. The young woman had a good arm, and her weapon flew true on the wind, even as did Sokka's boomerang. The throwing spear flew through the air, embedding itself a foot or more into the boarcupine's side, and they heard beast let out a great, pained, infuriated squeal as it wheeled around to face them.

Even as it rotated, though, Sokka's boomerang caught one of its forelegs, the sharpened bone edge slicing through a tendon before it flew back to him. The boarcupine listed a little to one side as one of its legs went limp beneath it, and they heard the snap of bone as the creature, unbalanced, found its weight now turned suddenly against itself, crushing one of its own legs beneath its ponderous bulk.

The boarcupine grunted furiously at this, hate gleaming from its great, beady eyes as it reared up onto its hindlegs and let out a terrible, enraged bellow. The crushed forelimb forelimb flopped uselessly from its shoulder, a gruesome mess. The beast leveled its hateful, enraged gaze upon the two hunters, beginning to run towards them. 1352212211112121211121111121111111111221.content:
When Azula heard the hull of the drill begin to groan, felt the great siege engine begin to pitch and list, its own weight turned against it, she knew that they had been thwarted. The fools who designed this tank had underestimated the defenses of Ba Sing Se, and the abilities of Sokka and the Avatar's companions. It would not be getting up out of the hole into which it was falling anytime soon.

And she was certain that if she stayed in here with Mai and Ty Lee, nothing good would come of it.

Taking a deep breath, she stabbed a palm forward, aiming for the glass windshield of the elevated, periscoped bridge. Cerulean fire melted the thick, clear glass like butter, and the force of the expanding, heated air was enough to blow out the front of the bridge, leaving a large hole.

Mai and Ty Lee needed no instruction to follow her in escaping through this hole, leaping out from the bridge to land atop the drill. Without missing a beat, they ran for the rear, leaping effortlessly over the gaps between the individual, jointed sections of the massive war machine.

Even as the drill listed forward, the weight of its falling fore-sections pulling the rest of it down as well, the earth beneath the iron behemoth cracking like fine china beneath the tread of a rampaging komodo rhino, Azula and her cohorts ran up its length swiftly and tirelessly. They gained progress slower than they might have liked, having to race against gravity as the brobdignagian drill fell down, the front-most sections compressing and buckling beneath the sheer weight as the rest of the engine fell down on top of itself in a peerless, deafening cacophony.

Screams pierced the air, the screams of terrified crew attempting to flee the wreck even as it was driven by inertia and gravity ever harder into the shards of sandstone and sedimentary rock, like the jagged teeth of a treacherous shoreline which caught the bodies of countless ships in wreck after wreck, broken and impaled upon the very bones of the earth. But the girls did not stop. They had their own objective, and they would not risk their bodies or their lives to save those who were too incompetent to save themselves.

At last, they reached the unbroken lip of stone at the uttermost edge of the crater, even as the drill finally came to a stop. A good third of its length still remained above ground, but they could feel the heat of fires surging behind them, and not the controlled burn of military benders.

There were engines located throughout the length of the drill, engines of Fire to power the countless mechanisms and gears of this incomparable feat of engineering. Steam scalded the heels of Ty Lee and Mai, who were lagging ever so slightly behind Azula, even as they leaped up over the edge and onto the ground.

They looked behind themselves to behold the wreckage of the mighty drill, the greatest weapon yet devised by the Fire Nation, the great, fired-steel Helepolis, the steam-driven Taker of Cities, devised for the sole purpose of conquering that which even the Dragon of the West could not defeat. And their hearts nearly sank at what they saw, for this mighty Drill, this great, titanic siege engine forged for the singular goal of the defenestration of Ba Sing Se, the Impenetrable City, this pinnacle of engineering, proof of the Fire Nation's technological superiority, was wrecked.

It had fallen, a catastrophic failure, in a cataclysmic upheaval of the earth, broken against the grinding teeth of the wastes outside Ba Sing Se, the scorched, salted wastes which once had been vast fields, verdant countryside, in a time before the War. It was a wreck, now, a great, broken, steaming wreck. Fume and flame and reek of charring flesh, black and thick and foul to breathe, filled the air, a pungent miasma of death and defeat.

Azula, Mai, and Ty Lee, in that one moment, their minds changed as they were, changed by suggestion and hypnosis to become obsessed with Sokka of the Southern Water Tribe, saw, with a frightful clarity that they would not have been afforded under any other circumstances, just how terrible war really was.

For the first time, they truly questioned the rightness of this so-called "March of Civilization" which sent the sons and daughters of their people to fight and die such ignominous deaths in far off lands, broken and bloodied upon the merciless jaws of the Earth, swallowed up beneath the tides of uncaring Waters. And hearing the agonized screams of their countrymen, seeing how pointlessly they were dying, and feeling the unthinking terror that descended upon them all in the face of ravening, gluttonous Death, they perceived how foolish the cause of the Fire Nation was, how meaningless all this century of unending bloodshed had truly been.

And their minds, for the first time, turned to thoughts which the Fire Lord would declare Treason. Their hearts, their minds, bent so thoroughly already towards one single man, conceived then a plot of peace and reconciliation. Treason, as Ozai would name it.

What next?

"Welcome, friends of the Avatar," said the two men stationed on either side of the large stone doors. They were dressed in a very dark green uniform, wearing wide-brimmed hats which covered their eyes. "The Grand Secretariat sends his greetings, and wishes you a peaceful stay in our fine city."

Sokka nodded absently at this, frowning just a little bit at the feeling of discomfort he was getting at the base of his neck. It felt kind of like he was being watched, except not quite. He wasn't sure how to describe it, other than as a sense of vague unease.

"Er, thanks," he said, uncertain how to address these two people. Something about these guys was... off, somehow. He couldn't possibly imagine what it was about them that gave him this feeling of paranoia, but they just seemed sinister, somehow.

He glanced sidelong at Yue, who looked a tad discomfited herself. He got the strange feeling these guys were focusing their gaze on his kinda sorta lover, and he wasn't sure how he should take this.

Belatedly, Suki walked up and gave a short bow. "My sisters and I are honored by the hospitality of our brother order in Ba Sing Se," she said. "Avatar Kyoshi's will lives on through us."

The two guys looked a little uncomfortable at this. Their posture betrayed subtle signs of unease, and Sokka almost thought he caught the glimmer of eyes flicking nervously to the side beneath the long shadows of their broad hats.

Suspicious.

Aang, however, came forward and greeted the two with a smile. Momo was on his shoulder, and Appa was at the rear of the group.

"Hello!" he said cheerfully, giving the pair an energetic wave of his hand in greeting. "We're here to see the Earth King!"

The posture of the two at this point became inscrutable, and they drew themselves up just a little bit, subtly adjusting their stances to emphasize their stature. It was scarcely noticeable unless you knew what to look for, but at this moment the two men suddenly seemed a lot more ominous and imposing than they had moments earlier.

Sokka frowned, taking a mental note of this reaction.

"Yeah," he said, standing up straight and puffing his chest out a tiny bit. "We have important information that could help end the war. We need to see the Earth King."

The two men were silent for a moment, seeming to glance subtly up the wall. Sokka couldn't see anything in the direction they were gazing, but apparently the pair found whatever they were looking for. They stepped apart, and a small section of the vast stone gate began lowering into the ground.

"There is no need to bother the Earth King with such trivial matters," said the man on the left in a perfectly inscrutable tone.

"You will be safe inside the walls of our city," added the one on the right, speaking with an identically emotionless inflection. "There is no war in Ba Sing Se."

Notai frowned at this, eyes darkening a little, and Yue looked a tiny bit troubled.

Sokka resisted the urge to scoff at these words. No war indeed.

"But what about the rest of the world?" he muttered under his breath as the gate finished opening.

The men, if they even heard his words, did not react.

The Gaang passed through the gate.

Her betrothal necklace was not the only thing Kanna took with her when she left her home in the North Pole. One other trinket also she brought with her, a small and curious thing which had belonged to her grandfather.

It was a ring, one of gold such as they had in the Fire Nation and Earth Kingdom. It had no markings upon it, and was set with no stone. Still though her grandfather had insisted it to be an item of immeasurable value.

As he had told it, one should have thought that little thing was the reason for his great fame as a hunter and fisherman, but Kanna did not think there was anything extraordinary about the ring. It was a very lovely thing, such that at times it was difficult to get it off of her mind, but she saw no reason for the man to have called this ring "Magical".

Kanna never wore it herself, but when she got to the South Pole she kept her grandfather's ring a secret from the distant kinsmen who welcomed her. Such trinkets as this were rare even in the north, and a part of her irrationally feared that one of the southern tribesman might be inflamed with greed at the sight of the ring, and try to take it by force.

So she kept it secret, hidden away in an old box. Almost she forgot about it, but every now and then her mind would go back to the ring, and she would feel an inexplicable urge to put it on.

But she had no care for such trivialities here in the south. She never wore it, and rarely even looked at it after inheriting the ring from her grandfather.

Until one day, that is...

Put the ring back where he found it
Stow it away in his pocket
155332222211.content:
It was quite by chance that young Sokka ever found the ring. He had been playing hide and seek with his sister, who was a master of squeezing herself away into the smallest of places.

Which was why he had been feeling around in that space behind Gran-Gran's medicinal chest, fingers groping around in the shadows for his little sister. It was too small a space for him to fit, but Katara was still young and small, and uncannily limber besides.

So Sokka had been looking for Katara behind the seal-hide chest, only to find something else entirely.

A box.

A very small box.

The young water tribesman withdrew the object from its hiding place, staring perplexedly at it. The box was a simple little thing, unhandsome and devoid of identifying marks. It was constructed from the same materials as the medicinal chest behind which it was hidden, although on a much smaller scale.

Now, Sokka -- then a mere six years old -- was a very intelligent lad. He wasn't as curious or adventurous as his sister, nor prone to poking through old nooks and crannies in search of "lost treasure".

But he still had his share of natural inquisitiveness. And, figuring that this box had simply been misplaced at some point, he crack it open to see what was inside.

This was the first time Sokka ever saw gold. It had a smooth, deep yellow glint, a flawless sheen and roundness that fascinated and entranced the lad. He touched the object inside the box, curious.

It was cool against his skin. The texture surprised Sokka, who was used to the feel of bone and ivory, which had the subtle natural roughness of minuscule bumps and ridges. This ring was smooth, so smooth that for a second he wondered whether it would not slip right out of his fingers.

What did he do next?
155332222211.title: ...when a young Sokka finds it

choices: He gets a gut feeling about where she's hiding
He finds her through trial and error
He stumbles across something else entirely while searching
1553322222111.content:
On an impulse, Sokka slipped the ring onto his finger. Despite being made for the hand of an adult, it fit him snugly. Like it was made for him.

In his youthful innocence, Sokka did not think to question this.

He looked at the ring on his finger, staring at it and smiling. For some reason it made him feel very happy to wear the thing. There was a giddy warmth in his belly, and he felt like he had just gotten away with sneaking a treat before mealtime.

For a moment, thoughts of mischief niggled at the back of the lad's mind. Something about having this ring on his finger made him feel bolder, more daring. He felt like he could do anything he wanted.

But Sokka ignored these impulses. He was a responsible boy at heart, and greatly respected the authority of his parents and Gran-Gran. He liked a good joke as much as the next person, but he wouldn't ever do anything hurtful.

After sitting and looking at his ring-clad finger from different angles for a minute or so, Sokka remembered that he had been playing hide and seek with Katara.

Getting up, he decided to go find her.
